issues.title: Implement OEM VPC Module (app, data, mgmt subnets)
issues.body:
### Summary
Terraform module to provision OEM VPC with application, database, and management subnets across multiple AZs.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Terraform module creates OEM VPC with segmented subnets (app, data, mgmt) across 2 AZs.
- Route tables are isolated per subnet type and documented in module outputs.
- No public internet exposure (no IGW attached unless explicitly parameterized).
- Module inputs for CIDRs, AZ count, and tags present.

### Implementation Notes
- Follow infra baseline patterns from Sprint 3.
- Add cost and env tags (Sprint 5 tagging conventions).

issues.title: Implement Supplier VPC Module (bench, internal, mgmt subnets)
issues.body:
### Summary
Terraform module to provision Supplier VPC with bench/test-client, internal services, and management subnets. NAT gateway optional and parameterized.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Supplier VPC created with three subnet types across 2 AZs.
- Optional NAT Gateway configured via variable (default: disabled).
- Subnet-level route tables and required outputs exist.
- Tagging aligned with Sprint 5 cost tags.

### Implementation Notes
- Reuse module patterns from OEM VPC module where applicable.

issues.title: Configure Hybrid Connectivity per ADR-001 (VPN/Peering/TGW)
issues.body:
### Summary
Deploy the connectivity mechanism chosen in ADR-001 between OEM and Supplier VPCs (support for VPN, VPC Peering, or TGW).

### Acceptance Criteria
- Connectivity resource deployed and attached to both VPCs as per ADR decision.
- Correct CIDR mappings and route propagation configured in route tables.
- Health checks or CloudWatch metrics exist for tunnels/peering status.
- Documented connection details in module outputs.

issues.title: Define and Apply Routing Tables for All Subnets
issues.body:
### Summary
Create and enforce explicit route tables for all subnets in OEM and Supplier VPCs to ensure only intended paths exist.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Supplier subnets route diagnostic traffic via the hybrid link to OEM.
- OEM subnets have return routes to Supplier via the hybrid link.
- No undesired transitive routes are present (document verification steps).
- Route table entries are output by Terraform for verification.

issues.title: Enforce Security Groups and NACL Boundaries
issues.body:
### Summary
Create strict security groups and NACLs to enforce least-privilege between Supplier and OEM, ensuring only diagnostic API ports are allowed.

### Acceptance Criteria
- SG allows only diagnostic API ports (TLS) from Supplier CIDR to OEM app subnets.
- OEM DB subnet denies Supplier ingress at SG and NACL levels.
- NACL rules present for subnet-level inbound/outbound restrictions and documented.
- Security rules tested and confirmed via connectivity tests.

issues.title: Deploy OEM Diagnostic API (Lambda/ECS) with TLS and OTEL
issues.body:
### Summary
Deploy a minimal diagnostic/CAN simulation endpoint in OEM VPC (Lambda behind private ALB or ECS) with TLS and OTEL instrumentation.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Diagnostic API deployed in OEM VPC app subnet and accessible only via internal network paths.
- TLS termination configured (private cert via ACM or self-managed) and OTEL traces exported to Sprint 4 observability stack.
- API logs available and integrated with CloudWatch/OTEL exporters.

issues.title: Deploy Supplier Test Client (Lambda/ECS) with Observability
issues.body:
### Summary
Deploy a test client in Supplier VPC that runs diagnostic calls to OEM API and exports latency/connectivity metrics to observability stack.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Test client can invoke diagnostic API over hybrid connection.
- Client exports latency and success/failure metrics to Prometheus/OTEL stack (Sprint 4 integration).
- Test invocation scripts and sample runs included as CI artifacts.

issues.title: Enable VPC Flow Logs (S3/CloudWatch) with KMS Encryption
issues.body:
### Summary
Enable VPC Flow Logs for both OEM and Supplier VPCs, delivering to S3 and CloudWatch with KMS encryption and retention per ADR-003.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Flow Logs created for both VPCs and delivering ACCEPT/REJECT records.
- Logs encrypted with KMS and retention policy applied.
- CloudWatch log groups created and accessible with correct IAM permissions.

issues.title: Integrate Flow Logs and Metrics with Observability Stack
issues.body:
### Summary
Wire VPC Flow Logs, API metrics, and test-client metrics into the Prometheus/Loki/Grafana/OTEL stack provisioned in Sprint 4.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Flow log queries available in CloudWatch Insights and sample queries committed to repo.
- Prometheus scrapes or OTEL receivers ingest relevant metrics (latency, packet drops).
- Grafana dashboard showing RTT, packet acceptance rates, and throughput created.

issues.title: Add Cost Visibility Tags and Network Traffic Cost Labels
issues.body:
### Summary
Ensure all network resources include Sprint 5 cost tags and that flow logs contain labels useful for cost attribution.

### Acceptance Criteria
- All VPCs, subnets, gateways, and connectivity resources tagged with cost-center, project, and env.
- Documentation explaining how to derive network cost from logs and tags included.
- Sample cost report template committed to repo.

issues.title: Implement Terraform CI Pipeline (fmt, validate, tfsec, checkov, plan)
issues.body:
### Summary
Add GitHub Actions workflows to run terraform fmt/validate, tfsec/checkov scans, and plan on PRs. Block merges on failing checks.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Workflow runs on PRs and executes fmt/validate, tfsec, checkov, and terraform plan.
- Plan artifact stored with PR and requires manual approval to apply to prod.
- Pipeline documented in .github/workflows/ and README.

issues.title: Automated Connectivity Tests (Terratest or Python utilities)
issues.body:
### Summary
Create automated tests to validate allowed and denied connectivity scenarios using Terratest or Python utilities from Sprint 1.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Tests verify API reachability from Supplier to OEM.
- Tests assert blocked access to OEM DB and management subnets.
- Test results stored as CI artifacts and pass in PR pipeline.

issues.title: Add Environment Lifecycle Automation (spin-up / spin-down)
issues.body:
### Summary
Provide scripts/workflows to provision and destroy dev environments quickly and cleanly (teardown cleans logs and state).

### Acceptance Criteria
- Script or GH workflow creates dev environment using Terraform and destroys it reliably.
- Teardown removes temporary resources, CloudWatch log groups, and S3 artifacts (or moves them to archive).
- Documentation included for usage and limitations.

issues.title: Update Routing Documentation (ROUTING.md)
issues.body:
### Summary
Document route tables and routing sequences for every subnet and connectivity option.

### Acceptance Criteria
- ROUTING.md includes explicit route entries per subnet and example verification CLI commands.
- Contains diagrams or ASCII flow for quick troubleshooting.
- Committed to docs/ and referenced in RUNBOOK.md.

issues.title: Update Networking Runbook (RUNBOOK.md)
issues.body:
### Summary
Create or update runbook with steps to debug connectivity, common failure modes, and log locations.

### Acceptance Criteria
- RUNBOOK.md includes step-by-step checks (route tables, SGs, NACLs, flow logs) and CloudWatch query examples.
- Contact and escalation info, and required IAM permissions listed.
- Stored in docs/ and linked from README.

issues.title: Create Final Architecture Diagram (OEMâ€“Supplier Topology)
issues.body:
### Summary
Produce final topology diagram showing subnets, route tables, connectivity links, security controls, and observability flows.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Diagram includes OEM and Supplier VPCs, subnets, route flows, and connectivity type selected in ADR-001.
- Exported PNG/SVG in docs/diagrams/ and referenced in README and RUNBOOK.
- Diagram reviewed and approved by team.

issues.title: ADR-004 Update: Firewall/Inspection Decision
issues.body:
### Summary
Finalize ADR to document whether AWS Network Firewall or SG/NACL-only approach is used, including rationale and logging model.

### Acceptance Criteria
- ADR-004 updated with chosen inspection strategy, cost and security trade-offs.
- Includes logging/alerting implications and rollback plan.
- ADR committed under docs/adr/ and referenced by infra modules.

issues.title: End-to-End Validation Checklist and Execution
issues.body:
### Summary
Prepare and execute an E2E validation checklist that covers routing, SG/NACL enforcement, connectivity, flow logs, observability, and cost tagging.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Checklist created and stored in docs/validation.md.
- All items executed with pass/fail recorded; failures documented with remediation steps.
- Test outputs attached to sprint PR as CI artifacts.
